channel.title: Less is better: RubyCLR is going to Microsoft

item.title: RubyCLR is going to Microsoft
item.description:
Well … maybe not the way you might have thought :)

Erik Meijer just informed me that my talk has been accepted at the Lang .NET 2006 workshop that will be held at Microsoft’s campus in August.

In a conference where talks will be given by

  • Miguel de Icaza
  • Gilad Bracha
  • Shriram Krishnamurthi
  • Anders Hejlsberg,
  • Paul Vick
  • Jim Hugunin

I’m pretty sure that I’ll be the dumbest guy in the room. But then again, that’s the only way that you can grow.
item.author: jlam@iunknown.com (John Lam)

item.title: "RubyCLR is going to Microsoft" by Michael O'Brien
item.description: Hey, congratulations! Sounds really interesting, make sure you keep us informed!

item.title: "RubyCLR is going to Microsoft" by Peter Krantz
item.description:
Congratulations. But I am not surprised. I told you this would happen back in February:-)

http://www.peterkrantz.com/2006/using-ruby-as-a-net-language/

item.title: "RubyCLR is going to Microsoft" by Jeff
item.description: Congratulations, John! Be sure to let us know how it goes.
